solution_line_template: Bran's scholarship pays ${tuition_fee} x {scholarship_percent} = $<<{tuition_fee}*{scholarship_percent}={scholarship_amount}>>{scholarship_amount} to his tuition fee.

So, the total amount he still needs to pay is ${tuition_fee} - ${scholarship_amount} = $<<{tuition_fee}-{scholarship_amount}={remaining_tuition_after_scholarship}>>{remaining_tuition_after_scholarship}.
And Bran will be able to earn ${monthly_pay} x {payment_months} = $<<{monthly_pay}*{payment_months}={earnings_from_job}>>{earnings_from_job} after working for {payment_months} months.

Therefore, the total amount he still needs to pay is ${remaining_tuition_after_scholarship} - ${earnings_from_job} = $<<{remaining_tuition_after_scholarship}-{earnings_from_job}={final_amount_to_pay}>>{final_amount_to_pay}.
